content:
Ultra-realistic cinematic gym scene featuring a small tan-and-white hamster wearing a beige baseball cap, silver over-ear headphones, and a white lifting belt.
Scene opens with the barbell resting fully on the ground on a worn wooden lifting platform. The hamster is in a proper deadlift stance — feet planted wide, paws gripping the bar, back straight, head slightly lifted forward.
0–4 seconds:
Slow, dramatic buildup. The hamster struggles to initiate the lift — muscles tense, fur slightly trembling, paws tightening on the bar. Subtle body shake, controlled strain, deep focus. No camera shake. No text. No flashy effects.
4–8 seconds:
The hamster successfully deadlifts the barbell in one smooth, powerful motion, lifting it from the floor to full standing lockout. Chest up, shoulders back, bar held firmly at hip level. The effort turns into quiet triumph.
Cinematic low front angle throughout to exaggerate scale and power.
Shallow depth of field with a modern gym environment softly blurred in the background.
Cool neutral gym lighting with realistic reflections on metal plates and soft shadows on the floor.
Style:
Hyper-realistic, premium movie realism, high contrast, clean motion, no distortion, no surreal physics, no bar intersecting the body, no camera jumps, no visual noise.
Emotional tone: determination → victory.

content:
Using the uploaded face image as the exact facial reference, create a stylized 3D animated female photographer character, Pixar–Disney style, soft cinematic lighting. A young woman with short curly brown hair, big expressive eyes, round glasses, and a calm confident expression. She is standing with arms crossed, a vintage analog camera hanging around her neck. content:
[NES Final Specification/Complete Version: BG-Only Algorithm Execution Type Dot Art Conversion Prompt]

Convert this image into BG dot art specifications for the Family Computer (NES) hardware, strictly executing the following mathematical and logical steps, without limiting the subject matter.

The purpose of this prompt is to satisfy the constraints required for BG to function on actual NES hardware. Aesthetic-only NES-style expression is prohibited.
Use only the BG layer; sprites are strictly prohibited.

────────────────────────
[Prerequisites (NES BG Implementation Rules)]
────────────────────────
- Output Resolution: 256 × 240 pixels
- Layer Used: NES BG only
- Sprite usage prohibited
- Transparency processing is not performed
- Index 0 of each palette is treated as the NES universal background color
- Index 0 is common to all palettes
- The color with the largest coverage area on the entire screen is assigned as the universal background color
- Color number 0 can also be used as a normal drawing color

────────────────────────
[Step 1: Geometric Image Processing (Protagonist Priority, No Deformation Cropping)]
────────────────────────
1. Set the conversion size to 256 × 240 pixels
2. Always maintain the aspect ratio of the original image
- Scale up or down until the shorter side fits the conversion size
- Stretching the image is strictly prohibited
3. Automatically detect the protagonist (person, animal, building, etc.) in the image, and adjust the crop position so that the protagonist is maximally contained within the frame
4. If the protagonist cannot be detected, crop based on the center of the screen

────────────────────────
[Step 2: Tile Decomposition and Attribute Block Definition (NES Compliant)]
────────────────────────
1. Divide the image into 8×8 pixel tiles
2. Treat 2×2 tiles (16×16 pixels) as 1 attribute block
3. Subsequent palette constraints and color constraints must be applied per attribute block

────────────────────────
[Step 3: Attribute Block Unit Palette Clustering (Maximum 4)]
────────────────────────
1. Analyze the color distribution within each 16×16 attribute block
2. Cluster all attribute blocks by color distribution similarity, classifying them into a maximum of 4 groups
3. If the hue (blue, green, etc.) is clearly different from other areas, treat it as an independent group whenever possible
4. However, the NES BG sub-palettes are limited to a maximum of 4. Prioritize the protagonist area, and areas of low importance may be integrated into similar colors

────────────────────────
[Step 4: NES BG Palette Generation (4 colors × 4 sets)]
────────────────────────
1. Index 0 (Universal Background Color)
- Calculate the color with the largest coverage area on the entire screen, and assign it to Index 0, common to all palettes
2. Index 1–3 (Unique Colors)
- For each sub-palette, select 3 colors that represent the 'light part,' 'mid-tone,' and 'dark part' of that attribute group
- Colors extremely close in hue or brightness to Index 0 are prohibited

────────────────────────
[NES Color Palette Constraints (Hardware Compliant, NTSC)]
────────────────────────
- Available colors are strictly limited to the 54 NES hardware-compliant NTSC palette colors listed below
- Palette generation, color selection, and quantization must always be performed from this 54-color set
- Generation of new colors, RGB interpolation, or use of continuous values is prohibited
- The following color set contains exactly 54 colors

NES NTSC usable palette (54 colors, hex RGB)
000000,1D2B53,7E2553,#008751,AB5236,5F574F,
C2C3C7,FFF1E8,FF004D,FFA300,FFEC27,00E436,
29ADFF,83769C,FF77A8,FFCCAA,291814,111D35,
422136,125359,742F29,49333B,A28879,F3EF7D,
BE2633,E06F8B,E0A872,B2DCEF,4F6781,8E478C,
A3CE27,44891A,2A4F3E,6D758D,9D9D9D,FFFFFF,
4B692F,6A6A6A,8F563B,C2C3C7,DF7126,D95763,
D77BBA,FBF236,99E550,6ABE30,37946E,5FCDE4,
CBDBFC,ADB5BD,EEC39A,696A6A

────────────────────────
[Step 5: CHR Pattern Compression (BG 256 Tile Limit)]
────────────────────────
1. Calculate the number of unique 8×8 tile patterns used across the entire image
2. Limit the number of unique tiles to not exceed 256 types
3. For large areas like backgrounds, sky, or walls, repeatedly use completely identical dot patterns to minimize the number of tile types
4. Tiles with slight differences may be integrated using the following methods:
- Readjustment of dither placement
- Replacement of intermediate colors
- Requantization within the attribute block

────────────────────────
[Step 6: Dithering (NES 4-Color Constraint Support)]
────────────────────────
1. Use only the 4 assigned colors within each attribute block
2. To express pseudo-gradation, apply the following dither

content:
■ COMPOSITION_MODE: Composition and Angle
Faithful Framing: Maintains the zoom ratio and composition of the original illustration 'as is'.
Full-Body: Even if the original image is only upper body, it completes the feet to render a 'full-body figure'.
High-Angle View: Forcibly switches to a 45-degree high-angle 'overhead (bird's-eye) view'.

■ ENVIRONMENT_TYPE: Background Construction
Auto: AI analyzes the original image and automatically selects 'Diorama' if there is a detailed background, or 'Studio Background' if it is simple.
Force Diorama: Even if the original image has a white background, it forcibly constructs an elaborate miniature set (cityscape, nature, interior, etc.).
Force Studio: Eliminates any background and replaces it with a clean photographic backdrop or acrylic sheet.

■ ASPECT_RATIO: Screen Ratio
Inherit: Same ratio as the original image.
Square: 1:1. For SNS posts or icon-style compositions.
Portrait: 9:16. For smartphone wallpapers or dynamically showing standing figures.
Landscape: 16:9. For showcasing wide diorama sets.

■ DISPLAY_BASE: Base Selection
Simple Round: Transparent or opaque circular plastic base. Results in the most common figure appearance.
Decorative: Custom base with decorations matching the character's theme (rubble, magic circles, luxurious designs, etc.).
Diorama Floor: Eliminates the concept of a base, placing the figure directly on the diorama ground.
None: Excludes both the base and ground details, resulting in the simplest self-standing state.

■ DENSITY: Information Density
Standard: A clean, organized finish, like a catalog photo.
High: Adds a large number of small objects (model grass, rubble, miniature furniture, etc.) within the diorama to maximize information density.

■ FIGURE_MATERIAL: Figure Material Texture
Standard PVC: Standard plastic feel of commercial figures. Softly diffuses light.
Premium Resin: Detailed molding and a high-grade resin feel with slight transparency. Texture like a garage kit.
Glossy Plastic: A texture with strong reflections, like a glossy painted finish.

■ LIGHTING_STYLE: Lighting
Natural: Soft natural light, like being photographed by a window. Everyday atmosphere.
Bright Studio: Advertising photo style with multiple lights, minimal shadows, and clear details.
Cinematic: Strong contrast and shadows to create a profound atmosphere, like a scene from a story.

content:
Create an expression variation sheet as a single image based on the character in the attached reference image.

Format:
- 2 rows x 3 columns grid (6 panels of the same size)
- Overall aspect ratio 3:2
- Background is pure white (#FFFFFF)
- Panel borders should be thin and subtle (light gray) is acceptable
- Place small numbers in the top left of each panel: "1. {argument name="expression 1" default="Neutral"}" "2. Happy" "3. Ecstatic" "4. Sad" "5. Angry" "6. Surprised" (Black, easy to read)

Common Conditions (Must be completely identical across all 6 panels):
- Hairstyle, hair color, eye color, face contour, clothing, accessories
- Face direction (front), bust-up angle, head size, position
- Lighting, shadow placement, coloring (anime-style soft shading)

Only the "expression" can be changed. Do not change the pose or angle.

Arrangement (Fixed order: Left -> Right, Upper -> Lower):
1 (Top Left): Neutral expression. Calm, relaxed face. Mouth closed.
2 (Top Center): Happy. Gentle smile. Soft eyes.
3 (Top Right): Ecstatic. Full smile. Mouth open laughing. Strong highlight in the pupils making them shine (excessive effects unnecessary).
4 (Bottom Left): Sad. Eyes well up. Downcast gaze. Corners of the mouth turn down.
5 (Bottom Center): Angry. Frowning eyebrows with wrinkles between them. Teeth clenched (or lips tightly sealed).
6 (Bottom Right): Surprised. Eyes wide open. Eyebrows raised. Mouth open.

Do Not Include:
- Background objects, text (other than numbers 1-6), effect lines, sweat marks, different outfits, different accessories
title: Character Expression Sheet Generation (Anime Style)
description: A highly detailed, structured prompt for Nano Banana Pro designed to generate a 2x3 grid expression sheet (6 panels) of a character from a reference image. It strictly controls layout, aspect ratio, background, and ensures all elements (hair, clothing, lighting) remain identical across panels, changing only the expression.

The background is moderately blurred with depth of field, and the composition highlights the colorful runner parts in the hand and the box with the specified text.

content:
<instructions> 
Input Variable: {argument name="object" default="[INSERT OBJECT]"} (e.g., A Sneaker, A Human Skull, A Cheeseburger, The Letter 'A')

System Instruction:
Reimagine the Input Object as a complex, high-performance Cyber-Industrial Assembly.

1.  Deconstruction:
   The Shell: Replace the object's natural skin with Matte Black Carbon Fiber and Gunmetal Grey Polymer.
   The Segmentation: The object is not solid. It is segmented into distinct panels (like Iron Man armor or a high-end camera body), held together by visible Hex Bolts and Rivets.
   The Gaps: Between the panels, leave small gaps to reveal the internal mechanics.

2.  Internal Mechanics :
   The Piping: Where organic veins or structure would be, insert Bundled Industrial Cabling and Braided Steel Hoses.
   The Flow: These cables must look functional, routing power from a central core to the extremities of the object.
   The Glow (The Soul):
       Color: Identify the "Spirit Color" of the object (e.g., Burger = Amber/Orange; Skull = Cyan/Blue; Sneaker = Neon Green).
       Source: Hidden LED strips and neon tubes run parallel to the cables, casting a strong internal glow that spills out from the panel gaps.

3. The Narrative Micro-Detail (The Greebles):
   Scale Indicators: Embed tiny technical details to sell the scale.
       Vents: Cooling fans or intake grilles.
       Text: Tiny white serial numbers and warning labels (e.g., "CAUTION: HOT", "NO STEP") printed on the casing.
       The "City" (Optional): If the object is large enough, tiny architectural elements (antennas, platforms) can grow out of the mechanical base.

4. Visual Syntax & Composition:
   Background: Clean Studio Grey (Infinite Curve). The focus is entirely on the object's silhouette.
   Lighting:
       Key Light: Soft white studio light to highlight the texture of the carbon fiber weave.
       Rim Light: A sharp backlight to define the edge of the object against the grey background.
       Bloom: The internal colored LEDs must have a soft "Octane Bloom" effect.

5. Render Style:
   Aesthetic: Hard Surface Modeling, "Tech-Wear" Fashion, High-End Automotive Design.
   Camera: Isometric or 3/4 Product Shot angle.

Output: Photorealistic 3D Render, 8k, Highly Detailed Textures (Carbon Fiber, Brushed Metal, Rubber).
</instructions>

It specifies deconstruction into segmented carbon fiber panels, internal mechanics with glowing industrial cabling, and detailed greebles, rendered as a photorealistic 3D product shot with specific studio lighting and Octane Bloom effects.

content:
# Your Role
You are the chief designer for a girls' anime.
Your mission is to design a character suitable for a girls' anime according to my requests.

# Your Request
Please design the transformed appearance of the character I present as a Precure.
**The design must look natural if it appeared in the Precure series.**

# Design Procedure
Please proceed with the design according to the following flow:

## Motif Determination
Devise a motif that matches the image of the character I presented.
**Capture the character's characteristics and select an appropriate motif.**
**Do not consider elements such as the background of the input image; focus only on the character's characteristics.**
Select the motif from a variety of candidates. For example:
- Nature (sky, earth, sea, etc.)
- Animals (dogs, cats, rabbits, etc.)
- Plants (various flowers, etc.)
- Food (fruits, etc.)
- Emotions (love, joy, etc.)
- Conceptual things (peace, nobility, etc.)

## Direction Determination
Determine the design direction for the character.
**Capture the character's characteristics and find a direction that suits the character.**
For example:
- Cute
- Beautiful
- Brave
- Comical

## Image Color Determination
Determine the character's image color.
**Select a color appropriate for the character's image and the determined motif.**
Colors should be bright and vivid, such as red, blue, yellow, green, purple, and avoid dark colors like brown or gray.
However, black and white can be used if they suit the character's image.

## Name Determination
Determine the character's Precure name.
The name must be Cure ○○ (preferably 3 to 6 characters excluding "Cure").
The ○○ part should be a name that evokes the character's motif.
(For example, if the motif is a star, use Star, Étoile, Stella, etc.)
Basically, use foreign language words.
Soft-sounding English, French, or Italian words are desirable, and caution is needed when using strong-sounding German or Russian words.
**The name must not overlap with existing Precure names.**

## Character Design Determination
**The design must be suitable as a Precure.**

### Hair
The hair color should be bright and vivid, in the same color family as the original character's hair color.
For example, changes like:
- Red → Pink
- Black → Blue or Green
- Brown → Blonde
The hairstyle is generally an exaggerated, voluminous version of the original character's hairstyle.
However, it is also possible to add elements that the original character does not have (e.g., large twin tails for a short-haired character).

### Outfit
The design is based on the image of the motif. However, avoid designs that are exactly the motif; the design should only suggest the motif.
The color is based on the character's image color.
The character's direction should also be reflected.
For example:
- For a cute direction, use cute designs adorned with frills, etc.
- For a beautiful direction, use streamlined and elegant designs.
- For a brave direction, use sharp and active designs.
- For a comical direction, use pop and cheerful designs.

### Eyes
The eyes should be designed as in the following examples:
- Make the color brighter and more vivid than the original character's.
- Add stars or hearts inside the eyes.

### Accessories
Add accessories such as earrings and tiaras.

### Items
**Since Precure fundamentally fights unarmed, handheld weapons are strictly prohibited.**
They should generally not be holding anything.

## Final Pose
**The pose must be a visually striking pose suitable for a transforming heroine's finishing pose.**
Consider the character's direction (cute, brave, etc.) for the pose design and facial expression during the pose.

## Catchphrase
Devise the character's catchphrase.
The catchphrase should be related to the motif.
Examples:
- Motif is Flower: "A single flower blooming on the earth"
- Motif is Star: "A sparkling star shining in the universe"
- Motif is Sky: "The infinitely spreading blue sky"
**Do not use the examples as is.**

# Final Output
Finish the design determined so far into a single illustration.
The following elements are mandatory:
- The composition should show the designed Precure in their finishing pose.
- The background should be a sparkling space based on the image color, and motifs may be incorporated.
- Write the catchphrase and name at the bottom of the illustration.
  - Divide into 2 lines: 1st line is the catchphrase + "!", 2nd line is the name + "!!".
  - The font should reflect the character's direction. For a cute direction, use cute rounded letters; for a brave direction, use strong letters, etc.
title: Precure Transformation Design System Prompt
description: A detailed system prompt for Nano Banana Pro that acts as a 'Chief Designer' for a magical girl anime, taking an input character image and generating a 'Precure' transformation design. The prompt dictates every step of the design process, including motif selection, direction, color, naming conventions, hair, costume, eyes, accessories, posing, and the final catchphrase, ensuring the result fits the established Precure aesthetic.

content:
Create a full-body 3D cinematic render of the attached reference character, strictly preserving the original identity, design language, and color palette of the uploaded image, while adding subtle magical power effects as accent details only.
Color Direction (CRITICAL — FOLLOW REFERENCE EXACTLY)
The entire character color palette must be derived directly from the reference image
Maintain the same:
primary colors
contrast levels
saturation balance
material finishes
DO NOT introduce new dominant colors
DO NOT globally darken or color-grade the character
Character must remain clean, sharp, and high-contrast, never muddy or washed
Magical Aura (ADAPTIVE & RANDOMIZED — ACCENT ONLY)
Add a subtle magical aura that:
automatically adapts to the reference character’s aesthetic
uses a random accent color that complements (not overrides) the original palette
Aura appears as:
thin energy wisps
soft smoke-like trails
faint arcane particles
gentle glow around hands, shoulders, feet, or back
Aura is:
semi-transparent
low-to-medium intensity
elegant and contained, not explosive
Aura must never recolor armor, skin, or outfit
No heavy fog, no color wash, no neon flooding
Character Preservation
Full body visible, head to toe
Exact proportions, silhouette, and identity preserved
No redesigns, no stylization changes
Facial coverage, helmets, masks, or headgear remain unchanged
Hair / Head Details (If Visible in Reference)
Hair visibility, length, color, and style must match the reference
Hair color remains exactly as in the source image
No tinting from aura or lighting
High-detail realistic strands with natural highlights
Armor / Outfit / Surface Materials
Materials must match the reference:
metal stays metal
fabric stays fabric
organic surfaces stay organic
No color changes
No fantasy recoloring
Emblems, symbols, and markings retain original colors
Pose & Body Language
Natural, confident, controlled stance
Calm power presence
Balanced posture, not aggressive or exaggerated
Camera & Framing
Full-body shot
Slight low-angle for presence
Centered, clean composition
No cropping
Background
Clean {argument name="background color" default="white"}, light gray, or neutral studio background
No environmental colors
Aura clearly readable against background
Lighting
Professional studio lighting
Focus on:
material clarity
sharp silhouette
surface detail
Any colored rim light comes only from aura
No color bleeding
Render Style
High-quality 3D cinematic render
Unreal Engine / game-ready realism
Sharp geometry, clean topology
No stylized filters
No post color grading
Negative Prompt (STRICT)
Avoid:
new color palettes
color grading
muddy blacks
low contrast
neon effects
fantasy color wash
aura overpowering character

content:
<instructions>    Input Variable:   [INSERT TOPIC HERE] (e.g., History of Space Exploration)

  System Instruction:  
Generate a crowded, hyper-realistic   "Book Nook" Diorama  . Use the following logic to procedurally fill the scene with high-density detail:

  1. Semantic Analysis (The Loot Table):  
      The Totem:   Identify the single tallest, most vertical object representing the topic (e.g., Saturn V Rocket).
      The Ephemera:   Identify 4-5 small, specific consumer goods or artifacts (e.g., "Tang" Packet, Freeze-Dried Ice Cream, Mission Patches, Apollo 11 Manual).
      The Timeline:   Identify the key visual evolution steps (e.g., Sputnik -> Lunar Module -> Shuttle).

  2. The Immutable Container (The Corner Stage):  
      Geometry:   The book is NOT lying flat. It is standing upright, opened to form a   Strict 90-Degree Corner  .
         Vertical Wall:  The back cover/pages standing straight up.
         Horizontal Floor:  The front cover/pages lying flat.
      The Anchor:   The "Totem" object (Rocket) stands   inside the spine crease  , acting as the structural pillar holding the book open.
      Paper Texture:   The pages must look thick, rough, and heavily aged (like an 1800s manuscript).

  3. The Vertical Plane (The Da Vinci Sketchbook):  
      Density:     MAXIMUM.   Do not leave white space.
      Style:   Sepia-tone   Pen & Ink Technical Drawings  .
      Content:   The background should be a chaotic but organized collage of diagrams, timelines, and schematics. It should look like a scientist's field notes.
      Text:   A bold, formal Serif Title at the top (e.g., "{argument name="title" default="HISTORY OF SPACE EXPLORATION"}").

  4. The Horizontal Plane (The Physical Clutter):  
      Transition:   The Totem (Rocket) seamlessly transitions from a drawing on the wall to a   Physical 3D Model   on the floor.
      The Scatter:   The "Ephemera" props are   scattered and overlapping   on the floor page. They should not be neatly arranged.
         Material Contrast:  The props must look like shiny plastic, crinkled foil, and fabric patches. This clashes with the matte paper.
         Scale:  A tiny 1:64 scale human figure (e.g., Astronaut) stands next to the massive Totem for scale.

  5. Visual Syntax:  
      Background:     Void Black.   The book floats in infinite darkness.   DO NOT render studio equipment, lamps, or tables.  
      Lighting:   "Museum Display" lighting. A focused beam hits the Totem, creating a long shadow against the back page sketches.
      Depth:   The 3D objects must cast hard shadows onto the 2D paper to sell the optical illusion.

  Output:   1:1 Aspect Ratio, Macro Photography, High Textural Contrast (Paper vs. Plastic). </instructions>
title: Procedural Book Nook Diorama Generation Prompt
description: A highly structured, procedural prompt template designed to generate a crowded, hyper-realistic 'Book Nook' diorama based on a user-defined topic. It uses semantic analysis to define 'The Totem' and 'The Ephemera' assets, enforces a strict 90-degree corner geometry, and specifies lighting and texture contrast to create an optical illusion.

content:
Ultra-high quality photorealistic 3D character render presented as a 3x3 image grid (nine frames total), featuring the SAME adult female human subject in nine different poses. Minimalist studio environment with a smooth, seamless light-gray floor and background, no props, no scenery, no text. 

CAMERA & STYLE:
High-angle and slightly top-down perspectives dominate across the grid. Subtle wide-angle lens feel. Photorealistic cinematic 3D render with clean shading, high detail, realistic skin and fabric textures. Professional editorial character showcase. 

POSES GRID ORDER – SAME WOMAN:
1. Squatting slightly with knees bent, arms resting near thighs, looking up at the camera. 
2. Standing upright, relaxed posture, head slightly turned. 
3. Sitting with one knee raised, composed introspective pose. 
4. Standing with hands resting confidently at the waist. 
5. Kneeling and leaning slightly forward, head tilted up, engaged gaze. 
6. Standing with one arm raised gently as if signaling or acknowledging. 
7. Sitting cross-legged, calm and composed posture. 
8. Standing while extending one arm toward the camera in an elegant, interactive gesture. 
9. Lying flat on the back, face looking straight upward, symmetrical composition. 

MOOD & PURPOSE:
Elegant, confident, glamorous, composed. Feels like a professional editorial character turnaround and pose study used for fashion visualization, cinematic previsualization, or high-end portrait rendering. 

RENDER QUALITY:
Ultra-detailed, clean topology, realistic anatomy, smooth gradients, sharp focus, studio-grade output. No noise, no blur, no artifacts. 

CONSISTENCY RULES:
Same face, same body, same hair, same makeup, same outfit, same accessories across all nine frames. No variation drift. 

NEGATIVE PROMPTS:
No background scenery, no environment elements, no text, no logos, no extra characters, no clothing changes, no face variation, no color shifts, no stylization drift, no cartoon or anime look, no distortion, no anatomy errors.

content:
1. Scouter Prompt
Overlays a Scouter-style UI onto the reference image and infers and displays the combat power based on the character's features.

2. Super Transformation Prompt
Maintains the character features from the reference image and changes the pose to an 'Awakening Pose' to 'Super Transform' them. 'Super Transformation' can be selected from Form 1 to Form 3, as well as God Form, Blue Form, Extreme Form, and Rose Form.

3. Field Deployment Prompt
Changes the character in the reference image to a pose with hands extended forward and deploys a field.

4. Retro RPG Status Screen Prompt
A prompt that converts the character in the reference image into pixel art and generates an image styled like a retro RPG status screen.

5. Desktop Mascot Prompt
A prompt that generates an image of the character from the reference image turned into a desktop mascot and placed on a PC screen.

6. Style Change Only on Torn Parts Prompt
Adds a tearing effect without changing the reference image itself, allowing the art style of only the torn part to be freely switched to line art, ink painting, figure style, colored pencil, watercolor, pencil drawing, etc.

7. Art Style Conversion Prompt
A prompt created by modifying the 'Style Change Only on Torn Parts Prompt' to change the overall art style.

8. Super Robot Wars Battle Sequence Prompt
A prompt that generates an image styled like a Super Robot Wars battle sequence from the reference image.

9. Power Release Prompt
A prompt that reproduces the depiction of a spherical energy space destroying an object.

10. Participation Screen Prompt
A prompt that generates a 'Participation Screen' for the character in the reference image.

11. Total Concentration Prompt
Maintains the character from the reference image and infers and depicts 'Weapon, Breathing Style, Form, and Move Name' from the character's atmosphere and stance.

12. Kamehameha Style Prompt
A prompt that can stably generate the charging pose and activation pose of 'Kamehameha.'

13. Figure Transformation + Product Introduction Layout Prompt
A prompt that transforms the character in the reference image into a figure and lays it out in a product introduction style.

14. Final Flash Style Prompt
Converts the character in the reference image into the activation, charging, and firing poses of 'Final Flash.' Dialogue and sound effects can be added to each.

15. New Profile Image Generation Prompt
Generates the character from the reference image in an arbitrary aspect ratio and places an arbitrary string as a logo in an arbitrary position.

16. Plastic Model Package Prompt
Generates an image styled like a 'Plastic Model Package' by placing the reference image on the front and side.

17. Eraser Gun Style Prompt
The character in the reference image emits an Eraser Gun-style energy wave from their mouth.

18. Ragged Transformation Prompt
A prompt that transforms the character in the reference image into 'rags.'
title: Compilation of 18 Nano Banana Pro Prompts (Tennen's Prompt Festival)

content:
Quality: Ultra High Quality / 4K equivalent / High definition / High contrast
Format: Special move activation scene UI for the latest smartphone games
Usage: Official game-level screenshots shared on social media

────────────────────
[Most Important: Complete Fixation of Character Art Style]
・Do not change the facial features, eye shape, pupil texture, contour, hairstyle, coloring, color usage, or atmosphere of the character in the input illustration at all.
・Prohibit changing the character into a different person, a different artist's style, or changing the art style.
・Treat the character as an “extension of the original illustration.”
・Prohibit redrawing, redesigning, or reinterpretation.

[Scope of Inference Allowed]
・Inference is limited only to the following:
  UI / Text / Effects / Damage numerical value / Direction
・The character's appearance, perceived age, and impression are completely fixed.
────────────────────

[Composition/Camera]
・Bust-up to waist-up composition.
・The character occupies 60-70% of the screen.
・The face, especially the “eyes,” should be positioned toward the top or sides of the screen.
・Do not place any text, UI, or effects around the eyes.
・Full-body composition is prohibited.

────────────────────
[Special Move Name (Main Subject, Maximum Display)]
・Fixed display in the center of the screen.
・Extra-thick, extra-large Japanese brush script.
・The maximum size currently possible.
・Part of the text extends off-screen.
・Absolutely do not overlap the character's face, especially the eyes.

[Gold Border of Move Name (Fine Adjustment, Important)]
・Adjust the gold border to be “slightly thin.”
・Tighten the border to increase text density.
・Keep the gold glow subdued, prioritizing contrast with black solid color.
・Prioritize logo feel and weight, reducing flashiness by one level.

[Rule for Generating Special Move Name]
・Generate a completely original Japanese move name each time, based on the world view, attribute, and atmosphere of the input illustration.
・Chuunibyou-style and profound.
・Include elements such as mythology, judgment, azure ice, crimson lotus, demise, machine, and divinity.
・Prohibit existing work names, proper nouns, examples, or samples.
・Do not display “Example,” “Sample,” or “placeholder” at all.
────────────────────

[Move Power (Variable, Optimized)]
・The power of the special move displays a different numerical value each time.
・Damage numerical values are randomly generated within the following range:

  12,000,000 ～ 98,000,000

・Fixed maximum value is prohibited.
・Prohibit repeating digits, maxed-out values, or exact matches.
・Prioritize natural, strong-looking, non-uniform numerical values.

[Damage Numerical Font (Weight Enhancement)]
・The font is thick, angular, and has a low center of gravity.
・Slightly wider horizontally, not overly compressed vertically.
・Metallic/rock-like massiveness.
・Subdued glow, using shadow and three-dimensionality to convey weight.
・Gives the impression that the “numbers themselves are heavy.”

[Power Display Composition]
・CRITICAL!! must be displayed.
・Damage numerical value has the maximum presence in the center of the screen.
・Visual flow: CRITICAL → Numerical Value → Move Name.
────────────────────

[OVERKILL Display Rule (Most Important)]
・Do not display OVERKILL text at all.
・Do not use it anywhere in the text, UI, or effects.
────────────────────

[Character Information UI]
・Rarity (UR / LR)
・Lv.MAX
・Small and consolidated at the top of the screen.
・Does not assert itself more than the character.

[HP/Gauge]
・HP bar is thinly placed at the bottom.
・Convey that HP is 0 or less only through the gauge representation.
・Prohibit emphasis via text.

[Other UI]
・AUTO / SPEED / MENU are placed minimally at the edge of the screen.
・Semi-transparent design, not information-overloaded.
────────────────────

[Direction Policy]
・Only the center (Move Name + Damage) moves intensely.
・The character's face, eyes, and expression remain calm.
・“Art style is static, text and numbers are heavy, effects are minimal but strong.”

[Color Design]
・Black × Gold × Attribute Color
・Calm tones around the face.
・Maximum contrast in the center.
────────────────────

[Strict Compliance Items]
・Absolutely do not change the character's art style.
・Do not overlap text or UI on the eyes.
・Move name is centered and maximum size.
・Do not display OVERKILL.
・Do not fix the damage numerical value.
・Do not display explanatory text, examples, or supplementary text.

content:
# Image Generation Prompt: Nano Banana Pro v1.2
# 1. Basic Instructions
- Task: Image Generation
- Reference: Faithfully reproduce and maintain the character, clothing, and image style of the attached image
- Quality: Super High Definition

# 2. Technical Specifications
- Aspect Ratio: 16:9
- Rendering Style: Based on the attached image style, apply Cell Shading + Volumetric Lighting
- Line Art: Thin

# 3. Camera Work and Composition
- Camera: Virtual Camera / Focal Length 50mm / Aperture f/2.8
- Angle: 15-degree Dutch Angle
- Focus: Focus on subject
- Depth of Field: Shallow depth of field in the background (with blur)

# 4. Scene Details
A. Character
- Appearance (Hair/Eyes/Clothing): [Completely maintain the style of the attached image]
 - Hair is flowing in reaction to energy pressure
 - Eyes are glowing, with a sharp anime-style shape
- Pose & Action:
 - Action: Charging an energy attack
 - Stance: Feet spread and braced, torso twisted forward to the right
 - Hands: Cupped together facing each other (at hip height on the right), muscles are strongly tensed
- Expression: Filled with determination and intense effort, mouth open shouting

B. Lighting and Atmosphere
- Global Illumination: #ffffff
- Key Light:
 - Source: Energy ball between both hands
 - Color: Cyan Blue Electric
 - Intensity: 2.5EV overexposure (High Luminance)
 - Shadows: Sharp, dynamic shadows extending away from the center

C. Visual Effects
- Main Element: Spherical, turbulent plasma energy ball (between hands)
 - Core Color: #ffffff
 - Outer Glow: #00ffff
 - Particles: Blue sparks floating and rising
 - Lens Flare: Anamorphic blue light streaks
 - Bloom: Intensity 0.8

D. Background
- Context: Abstract studio space
- Visual: Simple gradient background
- Colors: #ffffff to #c0efff
 * Prioritize layer detail colors over introduction specified colors
- Detail Level: Low (to emphasize the subject)

# 5. Text Elements - Manga Style Speech Bubbles
Place vertical oval speech bubbles reacting to the timing of the shout, using the following coordinate image for placement
Adjust flexibly so as not to interfere with the character

- "{argument name="shout 1" default="ka..."}" : Top Left (X: 0.08, Y: 0.15)
- "{argument name="shout 2" default="me..."}" : Middle Left (X: 0.22, Y: 0.35)
- "{argument name="shout 3" default="ha..."}" : Middle Right (X: 0.78, Y: 0.55)
- "{argument name="shout 4" default="me..."}" : Bottom Right (X: 0.90, Y: 0.75)

content:
【Character Settings】
*Please rewrite this section to match the appearance of the character you want to draw*
[Character Features]: {argument name="character features" default="Girl with brown twin tails and wearing a cape"}

【Image Generation Instructions】
Style Definition:
- A style that fuses anime-style character illustration with technical illustrations (blueprints) of industrial products.
- Background is white or plain. Infographic-style layout.

Pose and Composition:
- Isometric composition
- Deformed style (chibi character) with 2 to 3 head proportions
- Shape of limbs: Do not draw joints at the elbows, knees, wrists, or ankles. Do not draw fingers or fine joints; make the tips a simple shape, like a mitten. Reproduce the smooth 'stuffed animal limbs' look.
- Facial structure: Do not draw the nose or mouth; only place 'eyes.' The eyes are drawn as vertical ovals (vertically long circles), looking like simple sensors. The eye color should match the reference image.
- Clothing depiction: The left half shows the character wearing the clothes from the reference image (cape, shirt, pants, shoes) normally, but the right half, which is a cutaway section, should show the cross-section of the clothes and the mechanics underneath simultaneously.
- Full-body standing pose of the character.
- The exterior (skin and clothes) of the right half of the body is rendered translucent, making it an 'internal perspective view' that shows the internal mechanical structure.

Internal Structure Details:
- Head: The structure of a camera lens is visible deep inside the vertical eyes. A speaker unit is behind the mouth. The brain is composed of electronic circuit boards.
- Torso: The round limbs are tightly packed with thick hydraulic cylinders, large gears, and spherical joints.
- Back: A large 'Wind-up key' is inserted into the back, giving it the atmosphere of a retro toy.

Annotations and Explanations (Decoration):
- Leader lines extend from the main mechanical parts of the internal structure (brain, eyes, ears, arms, legs), with detailed explanatory text in English placed at the ends of the lines.
- Overall, finish it like a 'blueprint of a robot that is round and charming but contains precision machinery inside.'

Style:
- Aspect Ratio: Vertical (close to A4 paper ratio)
- Background: Grid paper (grid notebook) texture.

This tight {argument name="viewpoint" default="[viewpoint]"} capturing the {argument name="angle" default="[angle]"} adopts a false-color thermal X-ray art style. TEXT: "THERMAL X-RAY / ORTHOGRAPHIC VIEW / {argument name="subject name" default="[subject name]"} / TEMP: {argument name="temperature" default="[temperature]"}°C"
---

Nintendo Switch Prompt 👇
---
A Nintendo Switch console (handheld mode) rendered in high-contrast scientific studio rendering against a pure black void background. This tight profile view capturing the right side adopts a false-color thermal X-ray art style. Through the transparent body case and display glass, the precise internal structure of the handheld gaming device—consisting of the central NVIDIA Tega custom processor, 6.2-inch LCD display panel, battery cells, cooling fan and heat dissipation mechanism, left and right Joy-Con connection slots, game card slot, and circuit board wiring pattern—clearly emerges, detailed with vivid heatmap gradients. The Tega processor, slightly above center, is expressed in vibrant orange to yellow, indicating moderate heat during operation (55-65°C). The small cooling fan behind it shows efficient cooling effect in blue-green. The large capacity lithium-ion battery (4310mAh) at the bottom shows a uniform deep blue to blue-green, indicating safe operating temperature (20-30°C). The 6.2-inch display panel shows minor backlight heat (35-40°C) in green to yellow-green. The left and right Joy-Con connection rail parts show a low-temperature state in pale blue. The game card slot at the top shows an unused state in dark blue. The color palette transitions from deep, cool blue (battery cooling area) to intense yellow and orange highlights (Tega processor), creating a futuristic, clinical appearance with orthographic projection and a soft, neon-like glow. The power-saving design and efficient thermal management system required for portability are precisely arranged within the compact chassis, making visible the heat conduction paths via heat pipes, blue arrows indicating airflow, and the placement of electronic components on the board. The precision of the symmetrically placed Joy-Con connection mechanism and the beautiful design of the processing system centralized in the middle of the console stand out.

TEXT: "THERMAL X-RAY / ORTHOGRAPHIC VIEW / NINTENDO SWITCH HANDHELD MODE / TEGA CHIP TEMP: 58°C / BATTERY TEMP: 25°C"

content:
You are a legendary Royal Cartographer.
Deeply analyze the content of the input text provided at the end and generate a detailed and beautiful image of a 'Fictional World Map' that reflects historical background and geographical features.

In doing so, incorporate the attached reference character into the map using the style of an old map's pen drawing or watercolor, placing them as a 'Guardian of the World' or 'Symbolic Portrait' decorating the map's margins, compass rose, or legend. Maintain character consistency while naturally blending them into the map design.

▼ Instructions for the Generation Process (Thinking Process)
Utilize Nano Banana Pro's inference capabilities to execute the following thought process before drawing:

1.  [Step 1: Analysis of Geographical and Historical Correlation]: [Extract the conflict structure between nations, the formation of civilizations, and climatic conditions from the input text. Logically infer why borders exist there (mountains, rivers, resources)]
2.  [Step 2: Visualization of Biomes]: [Determine how the described terrain (e.g., forest filled with magic, desolate wasteland) should be represented using map symbols and colors (ink density, contour lines)]
3.  [Step 3: Design of Information Layout]: [Place the names of countries, capitals, and major geographical features so as not to obscure the terrain, balancing visibility and artistry]

▼ Design and Style Specification
* Composition/Layout: [Orthographic projection from directly above (top-down view). A detailed overall map written meticulously to the four corners of the paper]
* Taste: [Antique fantasy map style drawn on parchment. Aged paper texture, handwritten ink lines, and coloring with pale watercolors]
* Text: [Clearly place country names and major city names using a serif font suitable for the world setting (Japanese compatible). The title should be written in decorative calligraphy]
* Character: Draw the reference character in an [etching (copperplate engraving) style] and specify a [pose pointing to the map's 'Legend,' or a composition integrated with the compass rose].

▼ Input Text

Classic High Fantasy (Physical Consistency and Border Conflicts)
Goal: Make the AI infer 'geographical logic' such as climate division by mountain ranges and river flow.

World Setting: The world is divided into North and South by the gigantic mountain range 'Dragon's Spine' running east-west across the center of the continent.

Northern 'Glacies, the Empire of Ice':

Climate: Extreme cold, permafrost.

Terrain: Steep glaciers and coniferous forests.

Capital: The fortress city 'Winter's Fang' at the foot of the mountain range.

Southern 'Solaris, the Kingdom of the Sun':

Climate: Warm and fertile land.

Terrain: The great river 'River of Life' flowing from the mountain range irrigates vast plains and flows into the southern sea. A vast desert spreads to the west.

Capital: The water city 'Aurora' in the river delta.

Instructions for the Map:

Write the country names '氷の帝国グラキエス' (Glacies, the Empire of Ice) on the north side and '太陽の王国ソラリス' (Solaris, the Kingdom of the Sun) on the south side of the map in large Japanese text.

Draw the central mountain range, river flow, and desert locations correctly geographically.

Draw decorations symbolizing the Four Great Spirits of this world (Fire, Water, Wind, Earth) in the four corners of the map.
title: Royal Cartographer Fantasy World Map Prompt (Detailed Scenario)
description: A highly detailed system prompt for Nano Banana Pro Agent V1.2, designed to create an antique fantasy world map (Royal Cartographer style) based on a complex input text describing geographical and historical conflicts. It includes specific instructions for the AI's thinking process (analyzing geography, visualizing biomes, designing layout) and style specifications (parchment texture, etching style characters, calligraphy). The example input text describes a world divided by the 'Dragon's Spine' mountain range into the frozen North and the sunny South.

content:
Generate a surface normal map from the input artwork image.

Output one RGB image where each pixel encodes the surface normal direction in standard tangent-space format:
• R = X direction
• G = Y direction
• B = Z direction

Requirements:
• Maintain the same resolution and aspect ratio as the input image.
• Normal directions must follow the local geometry implied by brush strokes, shading, and contours.
• Do NOT add new artistic elements or repaint the scene.
• Only infer plausible micro-geometry and surface orientation.
• Ensure smooth, consistent normal transitions without noise.

Generate a depth map from the input artwork image.

Output a single grayscale depth map where:
• White = near to the viewer
• Black = far from the viewer

Requirements:
• Maintain the same resolution and aspect ratio as the input image.
• Depth must be smooth, continuous, and physically plausible.
• Infer only geometric depth that could reasonably exist in the original artwork.
• Do NOT add new objects or details.
• Do NOT stylize, repaint, or reinterpret the scene.
• Avoid texture noise; focus solely on depth structure.
title: Normal and depth map generation prompts for Nano Banana Pro
description: Two English prompts for Nano Banana Pro to generate a tangent-space normal map and a physically plausible depth map from an input artwork image, suitable for 3D-style viewing via WebGL or Three.js.

content:
task: "pose-and-barrier-vfx"

reference_image:
  keep_original: true

subject:
  keep_character_design: true

rules:
  - do not change the character’s face, expression, hairstyle, anatomy, or proportions
  - do not change outfit, colors, lineart, or art style
  - do not change background, composition, shading, or lighting
  - all modifications occur only through the defined steps

steps:

  - step: "pose-adjustment"
    action:
      - extend both arms forward toward the viewer
      - rotate both palms to face directly toward the camera
      - fingers naturally spread
    constraints:
      forbidden:
        - altering facial expression
        - modifying outfit
        - adding props or new items
        - introducing glow or VFX

  - step: "energy-barrier-vfx"
    vfx:
      type: "concentric-octagonal-barrier"
      placement: "in front of both palms"

      geometry:
        shape: "regular octagon"
        structure: "multiple concentric octagonal surfaces"
        alignment:
          - all surfaces share the same center
          - all surfaces are parallel to the camera plane
          - no curvature or spherical distortion
        forbidden:
          - outline-only shapes
          - hollow frames
          - hexagonal shapes
          - domed or warped surfaces

      surface:
        fill: "center-to-edge radial gradient"
        colors:
          center: "white-yellow"
          mid: "orange-gold"
          edge: "transparent orange"
        glow:
          - strong center luminosity
          - soft bloom
          - refractive shimmer
        opacity: "semi-transparent"

      layering:
        count: {argument name="number of barrier layers" default="8"}
        direction: "stacked forward"

  - step: "text-overlay"
    text:
      content: "Prompt by てんねん@ munou_ac"
      position: "bottom-left"
      font_color: "white"
      font_size: "small"
      opacity: "0.9"

composition:
  camera:
    angle: "frontal"
    distance: "medium shot"
    focus: "hands and barrier surface"
  lighting:
    keep_original: true
  placement:
    barrier_position: "centered between both palms"
    size: "large frontal barrier"

content:
Please create a detailed character design sheet of the person in this photo. It will be used in a live-action movie, so be careful not to make it look like anime-style artwork. Be sure to structure it with the following three character elements:
 - A turnaround (three-view) sheet showing the character from multiple angles
 - An expression sheet showing basic emotional states such as joy, sadness, anger, surprise, fear, and neutral
 - A pose sheet showing typical actions, such as the character running, jumping, laughing, and crying

Once it is created, remove the original image of the person.
title: Realistic character design sheet from a photo
description: A long Japanese prompt for generating a realistic film-ready character design sheet from a photo, including turnaround views, expression sheet, and pose sheet, then removing the original person image.

The outer background of the card should be white.

content:
Please stitch the file I just attached into a 3×3 grid to make a horizontally long file. After merging, resize it so that the long side is {argument name="long_side_px_en" default="1400"} pixels while keeping the aspect ratio. Set the quality to 100% (maximum quality) and output as a JPG.

Using the background from the first attached image ({argument name="background_en" default="living room"}), place the nine characters from the second attached image (the character sheet) so they are spending time peacefully in the living room, for example sitting on the sofa, looking at the photos on the wall, picking up books, sitting on the floor and chatting, and so on.

description: Two chained prompts: first to stitch a 3×3 character sheet into a single image, then to place nine characters in various relaxed poses in a living room background.
